name: Thug
content:
Thug was a green-skinned Gamorrean who served as a bodyguard to Jabba the Hutt, a crime lord who operated out of a palace on the planet Tatooine. Thug served alongside Thok, a Gamorrean who left Jabba's criminal empire by 0 ABY. Thug was still working for Jabba when Thok returned to the Hutt's service following the latter Gamorrean's role in assisting the Galactic Empire's Grand Admiral Demetrius Zaarin in a coup against Emperor Palpatine that took place in 3.5 ABY.
In 4 ABY, Thug was one of the Gamorrean guards present in Jabba's Palace at around the time that several Alliance to Restore the Republic operatives arrived in attempt to free their ally, Han Solo, who was held prisoner in the palace. Thug wielded a double-bladed Gamorrean Battleaxe, and was one of the many whom Jabba considered big, strong, and dumb guards who were good individually, and better when utilized in numbers.

Thug was created onset for 1983's Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi, the third film of the original trilogy. A photo of the Gamorrean was included in the 1998 Star Wars: Behind the Magic CD-ROM, although in-universe it is unclear if the character is in the film. Thug was first named in 2001, for the Star Wars Customizable Card Game's Reflections III expansion set.
